head.title: Community Newspaper Values Its Web Site

meta.content: Technology; New York and Region; Opinion
meta.name: online_sections

hedline.hl1: Community Newspaper Values Its Web Site

abstract.p: White Plains Watch publisher Susan Arterian Chang letter on July 2 article about Westchester news Web sites notes White Plains Watch is proud of its own site (S)

block.p: The article on July 2 about Westchester news Web sites fails to mention that The White Plains Watch, the only community newspaper in the county seat, also has a Web site. Indeed, the Watch Online at www.whiteplainswatch.com has added much value to the ''hard copy'' edition of The Watch. For example, this month's paper edition features a two-page spread of feedback we have received on the Tishman Speyer Town Center project. Most of the comments came to us via our Web site.

The article on July 2 about Westchester news Web sites fails to mention that The White Plains Watch, the only community newspaper in the county seat, also has a Web site. Indeed, the Watch Online at www.whiteplainswatch.com has added much value to the ''hard copy'' edition of The Watch. For example, this month's paper edition features a two-page spread of feedback we have received on the Tishman Speyer Town Center project. Most of the comments came to us via our Web site.

We believe most people still love to hold their community newspaper in their hands -- just as they do their New York Times -- and we will continue to publish our paper version as long as there is community demand for it. Meanwhile, our Web site is an increasingly invaluable tool for connecting with our readers -- far and wide -- and for enriching the content of our printed paper.
SUSAN ARTERIAN CHANG Publisher, White Plains Watch
